sentences.en: A new initiative was needed to break the logjam.
sentences.cn: 要打破僵局，就需要采取新的行动。

sentences.en: Israel may be able to help break the logjam in Lebanon too.
sentences.cn: 以色列或许也能帮忙打破黎巴嫩的僵局.

sentences.en: The legislation ran into a logjam.
The problem appears to be caused by a logjam of nerve messages.
sentences.cn: 据《每日邮报》1月28日报道,常言道“一心不能二用”,而引起这一问题的关键可能是神经讯息在传递过程中受到了阻碍.

sentences.en: The signing of Elton Brand has left Philadelphia with a a logjam at forward.
sentences.cn: 签下布兰德使费城在大前锋位置上有了一些小麻烦.

words.tran_cn: 僵局；（河道等）受圆木阻塞；停滞状态；拥挤

trans.tran_cn: （河面上）漂浮原木造成的阻塞，（因事情太多造成的）困境，僵局
trans.tran_en: a situation in which a lot of problems are preventing progress from being made
